WEXFORD/MISSAUKEE COUNTY DHHS
10641 W WATERGATE RD,
CADILLAC, MI, 49601-9424
RE: License#: CP830201508
Dear Ms. Adrianse:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 07/31/2025. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Douglas Turrill, Licensing Consultant
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City MI 49684
231-383-5531
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• The agency was informed DCWL is no longer auditing any DHHS Policy.
DCWL Consultants will only be auditing those rules described in the
"Licensing Rules For Child Placing Agencies" rule book.
• The agency was also informed that a social work contact documenting the
foster care worker reviewed the PATP with the foster parent and other
relevant parities and provided them with a copy of the treatment plan would
meet the rule when obtaining signatures was not possible.
V. CONSULTATION
• Consultation was not requested or required at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators Assessment was reviewed. The assessment did not
address a CAP as the agency was not required to submit one in the licensing
year. The assessment reported that a common barrier is finding appropriate
placements for children. The report reported there were two disrupted placements
of youth in CCI's and they had to be removed because of behaviors. The
assessment also detailed the Monthly Management Report of key compliance
indicators.
Financial Overview
The agency is a local DHHS office and financial records were not available.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff reported they have a strong supportive foster care team. Staff further
reported their respective supervisors are very supportive and knowledgeable.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in a modern local DHHS office in Cadillac. There is
sufficient office space for staff and visitors. CHRI documents were observed to be
secured as required.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst identified four safety alerts during her visits to the homes. They
are as follows;
Safety Alert #1. A safety alert was generated on 06/02/2025 as a fire alarm was not
operable due to the device not having an installed battery.
Resolution: Resolution was achieved on 06/05/2025 as a battery was installed and
photos provided.
Safety Alert #2. A safety alert was generated on 05/28/2025 as the home did not
have a carbon monoxide detector and there was not a smoke alarm near the child's
bedroom.
Resolution: Resolution was achieved on 06/05/2025 as a carbon monoxide
detector was installed and a smoke alarm was placed in the bedroom hallway closest
to the living room. Photos of the installed devices were provided.
Safety Alert #3. A safety alert was generated on 06/02/2025 as the basement of the
home did not have a smoke alarm and also a smoke alarm was missing near a
bedroom on the main floor.

Resolution: Resolution was obtained on 06/05/2025 as the smoke alarms were
installed and photos of the installed devices were provided.
Safety Alert #4. A safety alert was generated on 07/02/2025 as the home did not
have a carbon monoxide detector.
Resolution: Resolution was obtained on 07/07/2025 as a carbon monoxide detector
was installed and photo of the installed device was provided.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
July 31, 2025
_____________________________________
Douglas Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant

August 5, 2025
